news_summary: Scientists have developed eco-friendly sunscreen using pollen, creating coral-safe protection that supports marine conservation.

articles.content:
BY THE OPTIMIST DAILY EDITORIAL TEAM

A team of scientists developed a pollen-based sunscreen that blocks harmful ultraviolet rays without endangering coral reefs. Their findings suggest the new formula could be as effective as traditional sunscreens but without the environmental toll.

“We wanted to develop an affordable and effective natural sunscreen that is non-allergenic to humans and eco-friendly to the environment,” explained Nam-Joon Cho, lead author of the study and professor of materials science and engineering at Nanyang Technological University in Singapore.

Testing sunscreen against corals

To compare the effects, researchers placed equal amounts of their pollen sunscreen and a commercial sunscreen into separate 10-liter seawater tanks containing healthy coral. The results were stark: within two days, the commercial sunscreen triggered bleaching, and within six days, it caused coral death. By contrast, the corals exposed to the pollen-based gel remained healthy throughout the 60-day trial.

The team focused on two types of pollen: sunflower and camellia. While sunflower pollen-based sunscreen reached a sun protection factor (SPF) below 5 (and can also trigger allergies) camellia pollen stood out. Its SPF of 27.3 means it blocks about 97 percent of ultraviolet rays, and camellia pollen is typically non-allergenic.

“We know that pollen is naturally UV-resistant, as its shell needs to protect its inner contents from harsh environmental conditions, including sunlight,” Cho said. “Our research aimed to develop a way to process pollen grains into a gel-like form, so that they can be easily applied to human skin.”

The problem with conventional sunscreens

Every year, an estimated 6,000 to 14,000 metric tons of UV filtering chemicals from commercial sunscreens wash into coral-rich coastal waters. Chemicals such as zinc oxide and titanium oxide are known contributors to coral reef decline and can disrupt seagrass and other marine life. Studies have even detected these compounds in dolphins, rainbow trout, and loggerhead turtles.

And while some sunscreens carry a “coral-safe” label, research suggests they are often only slightly less toxic than conventional products.

“This is the type of research we want to see in the development of sunscreen alternatives that are more sustainable,” said David Andrews, acting chief science officer at the nonprofit Environmental Working Group, who was not involved in the study. He added that the work underscores “one of the deficiencies in sunscreen regulation with respect to fully considering the impact that these products could be having on coral or marine environments.”

A safer path forward

The study offers hope that natural solutions could replace harmful ingredients in sunscreens, protecting both people and ecosystems. While more testing and regulatory review will be needed, the pollen-based sunscreen demonstrates how rethinking everyday products can have ripple effects for human health and the planet.

“The bigger picture here,” Andrews noted, “is that our chemical regulations and the regulation of sunscreen products are not encompassing enough.” Research like this, he stressed, helps point the way toward more comprehensive and sustainable solutions.

Source study: Advanced Functional Materials—Nature’s guard: UV filter from pollen

articles.personality_title: Scientists create coral-safe sunscreen using pollen
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context** – Many sunscreens use chemicals that harm coral reefs when they wash into the ocean. These chemicals can cause coral to bleach and die, which hurts marine life and ecosystems.

**What happened** – Scientists at Nanyang Technological University in Singapore developed a new sunscreen made from pollen, especially from camellia flowers. This pollen-based sunscreen blocks about 97% of harmful ultraviolet (UV) rays. When tested, it kept coral healthy for 60 days, unlike regular sunscreens that caused coral bleaching and death in just a few days.

**Impact** – This new sunscreen can protect people from the sun without damaging coral reefs. Since coral reefs support many ocean animals and plants, protecting them helps keep the ocean healthy. Also, camellia pollen is usually safe for people and less likely to cause allergies.

**What's next step** – The researchers will continue testing the pollen sunscreen and work on getting approval from health and environmental agencies. If it passes, this natural sunscreen could become a safer option for swimmers, beachgoers, and anyone who needs sun protection.

**One-sentence takeaway** – A pollen-based sunscreen offers effective sun protection that keeps coral reefs safe from harmful chemicals found in traditional sunscreens.
articles.personality_title_fr: Des scientifiques créent une crème solaire sûre pour les coraux à base de pollen
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte** – De nombreuses crèmes solaires contiennent des produits chimiques qui endommagent les récifs coralliens lorsqu'ils se retrouvent dans l'océan. Ces produits chimiques peuvent provoquer le blanchissement et la mort des coraux, ce qui nuit à la vie marine et aux écosystèmes.

**Ce qui s'est passé** – Des scientifiques de l'Université technologique de Nanyang à Singapour ont développé une nouvelle crème solaire faite à partir de pollen, notamment de fleurs de camélia. Cette crème solaire à base de pollen bloque environ 97 % des rayons ultraviolets (UV) nocifs. Lors des tests, elle a maintenu les coraux en bonne santé pendant 60 jours, contrairement aux crèmes solaires classiques qui provoquaient le blanchissement et la mort des coraux en quelques jours.

**Impact** – Cette nouvelle crème solaire peut protéger les personnes du soleil sans endommager les récifs coralliens. Comme les récifs coralliens soutiennent de nombreux animaux et plantes marins, les protéger aide à maintenir la santé des océans. De plus, le pollen de camélia est généralement sûr pour les personnes et moins susceptible de provoquer des allergies.

**Prochaine étape** – Les chercheurs vont continuer à tester cette crème solaire à base de pollen et travailler pour obtenir l'approbation des agences de santé et environnementales. Si elle est approuvée, cette crème solaire naturelle pourrait devenir une option plus sûre pour les nageurs, les visiteurs de la plage et toutes les personnes ayant besoin d'une protection solaire.

**Phrase clé** – Une crème solaire à base de pollen offre une protection solaire efficace tout en préservant les récifs coralliens des produits chimiques nocifs des crèmes solaires traditionnelles.
articles.personality_title_es: Científicos crean protector solar seguro para corales usando polen
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto** – Muchos protectores solares usan químicos que dañan los arrecifes de coral cuando llegan al océano. Estos químicos pueden causar que los corales se decoloren y mueran, lo que afecta a la vida marina y los ecosistemas.

**Qué pasó** – Científicos de la Universidad Tecnológica de Nanyang en Singapur desarrollaron un nuevo protector solar hecho de polen, especialmente de flores de camelia. Este protector solar bloquea alrededor del 97 % de los rayos ultravioleta (UV) dañinos. En pruebas, mantuvo los corales saludables durante 60 días, mientras que los protectores solares normales causaron decoloración y muerte en pocos días.

**Impacto** – Este nuevo protector solar puede proteger a las personas del sol sin dañar los arrecifes de coral. Como los arrecifes de coral sostienen a muchos animales y plantas marinas, protegerlos ayuda a mantener el océano saludable. Además, el polen de camelia es generalmente seguro para las personas y menos probable que cause alergias.

**Próximo paso** – Los investigadores seguirán probando este protector solar de polen y trabajarán para obtener la aprobación de agencias de salud y medio ambiente. Si lo logran, este protector solar natural podría convertirse en una opción más segura para nadadores, visitantes de la playa y cualquiera que necesite protección solar.

**Frase clave** – Un protector solar a base de polen ofrece protección efectiva contra el sol mientras mantiene seguros a los arrecifes de coral de los químicos dañinos de los protectores solares tradicionales.
